website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus M.Zuiko Digital ED 12-40mm f2.8 PRO lens lives up to its moniker, delivering professional results when paired with a Micro Four Thirds camera.
pros: Maximum f/2.8 aperture throughout zoom range
Very sharp from edge to edge
Protected from dust, splashes, and cold temperatures

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is another amazing lens from Olympus. I have the 40-150 f2.8 and this is every bit as good, it's become my walkabout lens. Sharp even wide open at 12mm. I bought mine through Amazon from Camarthan Cameras, it was split from a kit so sold as second hand, having checked with the supplier they are unused, it just that you don't get the box(unless it's a brownie I don't take pictures with the box!). This made the lens over £200 cheaper. I registered the lens on the Olympus site and they confirmed the warranty plus their usual 6 month extension. Highly recommend Camarthan Cameras great to deal with and friendly on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: K4Cam

customer_reviews.title: Best Lense I Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: The best lens I've ever owned. Clear, sharp, good contrast, good colour tones, good focusing. Looks like quality, works like quality, feels like quality... robust, solid, smooth action. Does perfect landscapes, does perfect macros, and portraits, and anything inbetween.... and is as good as any prime lens of any genre I've ever owned. I sold four lenses to buy this, and it was worth it...because this is so good I now don't need those 4 lenses...and that's all that matters!
customer_reviews.author: JoGo

customer_reviews.title: As good as it should be
customer_reviews.text: A solid lump of a lens but still lighter and much more compact than a full frame equivalent. As a Garden Photographer I find the focal length range and the closest focus ideal. My old Canon lenses don't focus quite close enough for plant portrait work and close ups but this lens does it well. I'm using it on an OMD-M5 to good effect no doubt the EM1 would make even more of it's capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Bosky Badger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great all rounder.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using a Canon lens and the GH5 Panasonic zooms on my GH5. A friend had one and loved the work he was doing so bought my own. It is a great lens. It is now pretty much permanently attached to the GH5. It just works, has a very nice look to it. Very little distortion and lovely and sharp, when I manage to get it in focus.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sunderland

customer_reviews.title: The image quality is great and the focus ring is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is great and the focus ring is fantastic, as you can change easily between manual and auto focus. So if you're trying to take a macro picture and focus goes to infinity, you just pull focus back to a near point and auto focus finds the focus point nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Kuhnert

customer_reviews.title: Delivers everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My first Olympus PRO lens and it delivers well. It gives just that little extra wide angle from the kit lens on my EM-10 MkII with a satisfying weight, fast auto focus (manual focussing is just a slide of the focus ring away if you wished), firm but not over-tight action on the zoom and it has proved useful in lower light situations whilst taking church interior shots. As a novice it feels well balanced too and came supplied with lens hood and pouch. True, I could have purchased two lesser lenses for the price but I've ended up with a great all-rounder and feel confident in saving for the 40-150mm PRO lens.
customer_reviews.author: badger_beard

customer_reviews.text: the buttttt is, the zoom ring rotated the wrong way (compared to my panasonic lenses) it was pretty big and heavy, no Image stabilisation in the lens and didn't seem quite as wide at the wide end as other 12mm lenses. but the optical quality is fantastic, the focus speed great, and the DOF good for portraits at 40mm f/2.8 just a bit to big and heavy with no IS that was my problem

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality indeed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with my GH4, sacrificing lens stabilization for movies for sharpness. (The camera body stabilizes images) Fantastic lens, really sharp through all the stops (slight softening at zoom but that's being really picky) and as an incredibly virtually distortion free lens works great as a taking lens for a SLR magic Anamorphot (from about 18mm onwards- vignettes before then) The wide angle is great (24mm @ 35mm equivalent, 28mm when filming 4K on GH4) and sharp edge to edge. Peaking (guides) and auto focusing/aperture etc all still work with the GH4 (electronic zoom not applicable). Very happy with this being the ONLY lens I will need. Pro quality indeed.
